doc:
Geraldine Farrar https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geraldine_Farrar 0 Alice Geraldine Farrar (February 28, 1882 – March 11, 1967) was an American soprano opera singer and film actress, noted for her beauty, acting ability, and "the intimate timbre of her voice." She had a large following among young women, who were nicknamed "Gerry-flappers". Alice_Geraldine_Farrar ( February_28_,_1882 – March_11_,_1967 ) was an_American_soprano_opera_singer_and_film_actress , noted for her_beauty , acting ability , and " the_intimate_timbre of her_voice . " She had a_large_following among young_women , who were_nicknamed " Gerry-flappers " .
